key_channel_insights.line_content: 93.3 % of OTA fares matched the website (+3.9 pp MoM) with a tiny 0.19 % premium; only long-haul shows material deviation.
MSE priced below the site on 95.8 % of itineraries, yet the average discount is just −0.08 %, suggesting limited absolute revenue leakage.
97.1 % of GDS fares exceeded the website, although the average premium is modest at +0.42 ppt and coverage gaps continue to narrow.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 93.3 % of OTA fares matched the website last week, +1.4 pp WoW and +3.9 pp MoM—industry-leading consistency.
Only 2.2 % of itineraries were higher on OTA, and the average premium fell to 0.19 %, down 0.08 pp MoM.
Long-haul parity at 87 % trails other segments, with a 0.34 % premium on 9 % of ODs.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA carried no offer on 3.2 % of ODs, improving 0.9 pp MoM.
Parity at 93.3 % is rising steadily and now covers virtually all key ODs.
Discounting is limited: 1.2 % of ODs averaged a −0.07 % undercut, flat MoM.
Higher-priced OTAs fell 2.9 pp MoM to 2.2 %, with the premium trimmed to 0.19 %.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 93.5 %; OTA premiums on just 2.1 % of ODs with a 0.17 % markup.
Parity 86.9 %; 8.7 % of ODs see a 0.34 % markup and 4.4 % are undercut.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: AT ODs show 93.9 % parity; premiums on 2.2 % of itineraries average 0.08 %.
Parity slips to 92.6 %; premiums similar in frequency (2.3 %) but four times larger at 0.32 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Same-price share 93.5 %; premiums limited to 1.8 % of itineraries with a 0.14 % markup.
Parity dips to 92.3 %; premiums double to 3.2 % of itineraries, averaging 0.26 %—though improving 3.5 pp MoM.

mse_highlights.line_content: 95.8 % of ODs priced lower on MSE than the site, up 2 pp WoW and 3 pp MoM.
Average discount only −0.08 %, limiting revenue impact despite prevalence.
‘Web fare missing’ down to 2.7 %, a 20 % MoM improvement.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Lower-than-site fares on 95.8 % of ODs; average undercut −0.08 %.
Only 1.6 % of ODs at parity, down 55 % WoW.
Web fare absent on 2.7 % of ODs; down 5 % WoW and 20 % MoM.
No higher-than-site fares recorded this week (0.0 %).

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 96.0 % of short-haul routes cheaper on MSE with a −0.08 % gap.
87.5 % of long-haul ODs lower; undercut margin steady at −0.08 %.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From AT PoS, 96.8 % of ODs cheaper on MSE; zero higher-priced cases.
Outside AT, 94.7 % of ODs lower with a −0.07 % gap.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 0–7 days: 95.4 % of itineraries cheaper, discount deepens to −0.10 %.
8 + days: 96.5 % cheaper (+5.1 pp WoW); gap milder at −0.04 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: 97.1 % of GDS itineraries priced above the site; parity or discounts appear in only 0.2 % of cases.
Average GDS premium just +0.42 ppt overall, +0.56 ppt on far-out bookings.
‘Website offer not found’ fell 0.47 pp MoM, but higher-priced share rose 0.25 pp.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS lacked a matching fare on 2.7 % of ODs, down 0.47 pp MoM.
Exact matching stuck at 0.11 % of ODs.
Only 0.11 % of itineraries cheaper in GDS; share contracted further MoM.
Overpriced cases 97.1 %, rising 0.14 pp WoW; average premium ~+0.42 ppt.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 97.2 % higher with +0.43 ppt premium; frequency up 0.48 pp MoM.
91.7 % higher, 4.2 % same, 4.2 % lower; premium negligible at +0.05 ppt.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.2 % higher with +0.35 ppt premium; coverage gaps narrowed 0.35 pp MoM.
Premium slightly larger at +0.51 ppt; parity/lower fares in 0.46 % of cases.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS higher on 96.9 % of bookings with +0.36 ppt premium; stable MoM.
97.5 % higher with +0.56 ppt premium; frequency up 1.52 pp MoM.
